intro: Billardiera elongata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, waxy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant attaches to host trees, such as eucalypts, through its haustoria to absorb water and nutrients. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Billardiera elongata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for native fauna and contributing to biodiversity.
